class.name: DoubleElementHandler
class.javadoc:
This class is intended to handle <double> element. This element specifies {@code double} values. The class {@link Double} is used as wrapper for these values. The result value is created from text of the body of this element. The body parsing is described in the class {@link StringElementHandler}. For example:
                  <double>1.23e45</double>
is shortcut to
                  <method name="valueOf" class="java.lang.Double">
                  <string>1.23e45</string>
                  </method>
which is equivalent to {@code Double.valueOf("1.23e45")} in Java code.

The following atribute is supported:

id
the identifier of the variable that is intended to store the result
1.7 Sergey A. Malenkov

Creates {@code double} value from the text of the body of this element.
argument the text of the body
evaluated {@code double} value
